intro: Maxillariella variabilis var. unipunctata, commonly known as the spotted maxillariella, is a hybrid orchid species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant typically features a single, short stem with a few leaves and blooms during the summer months. Its flowers have a unique pattern of dark spots, which give it its common name. This orchid is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation.
